page.title: 07Tramways and Railways
page.content: {TRAMWAYS AND RAILWAYS Nantyglo iron furnaces were erected in 1795.The iron produce was transported to the Newport-Crumlin Canal via tramroads.The Newport and Nantyglo Railway was proposed by local iron masters,Joseph and Crawshay Bailey,in 1842.The proposal was sanctioned by Parliament in 1845 for a railway with a gauge of 4ft.8in.The railway made use of converted tramways.Nantyglo Ironworks provided much of the tramplates,rolling stock and rails. Brynmawr was connected to the railhead at Coalbrook Vale via a tramroad.In 1849 Monmouthshire Railway established a goods station at Brynmawr but the passenger service was never extended beyond Nantyglo.The LNWR built a branch off the Merthyr-Abergavenny line from Brynmawr to Blaenavon Ironworks in 1870.
